_**The Vampire Diaries**_ is an American
[supernatural](/wiki/Supernatural_fiction "Supernatural fiction")
[drama](/wiki/Drama_\(film_and_television\) "Drama \(film and television\)")
television series developed by [Kevin
Williamson](/wiki/Kevin_Williamson_\(screenwriter\) "Kevin Williamson
\(screenwriter\)") and [Julie Plec](/wiki/Julie_Plec "Julie Plec"), based on
the popular [book series of the same
name](/wiki/The_Vampire_Diaries_\(novel_series\) "The Vampire Diaries \(novel
series\)") written by [L. J. Smith](/wiki/L._J._Smith_\(author\) "L. J. Smith
\(author\)"). The series premiered on [The CW](/wiki/The_CW "The CW") on
September 10, 2009, and concluded on March 10, 2017, airing 171 episodes over
eight seasons.

The [pilot episode](/wiki/Pilot_\(The_Vampire_Diaries\) "Pilot \(The Vampire
Diaries\)") attracted the largest audience for The CW of any series premiere
since the network began in 2006;[1] the [first
season](/wiki/The_Vampire_Diaries_\(season_1\) "The Vampire Diaries \(season
1\)") averaged 3.60 million viewers.[2] It was the most-watched series on the
network before being supplanted by _[Arrow](/wiki/Arrow_\(TV_series\) "Arrow
\(TV series\)")_. The show has received numerous award nominations, winning
four [People's Choice Award](/wiki/People%27s_Choice_Awards "People's Choice
Awards") and many [Teen Choice Awards](/wiki/Teen_Choice_Awards "Teen Choice
Awards").

On April 26, 2013, The CW officially announced that the spin-off _[The
Originals](/wiki/The_Originals_\(TV_series\) "The Originals \(TV series\)")_ ,
which focuses on the Original family of vampires, had been ordered to series,
and the show began airing during the [2013–14 American television
season](/wiki/2013%E2%80%9314_United_States_network_television_schedule
"2013–14 United States network television schedule").[3]

On April 6, 2015, lead actress [Nina Dobrev](/wiki/Nina_Dobrev "Nina Dobrev")
confirmed via [Instagram](/wiki/Instagram "Instagram") that she and co-star
[Michael Trevino](/wiki/Michael_Trevino "Michael Trevino") (who plays [Tyler
Lockwood](/wiki/Tyler_Lockwood "Tyler Lockwood")) would be leaving the show
after its sixth season. Dobrev returned to record a voiceover for the seventh-
season finale.[4] Trevino appeared as a guest star in season seven and
returned for season 8.[5][6] On March 11, 2016, The CW renewed the series for
an eighth season,[7] but on July 23, 2016, announced that the eighth season,
which would have 16 episodes, would be the show's last.[8] The final season
began airing on October 21, 2016.

## Series
overview[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Vampire_Diaries&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Series overview")]

The series is set in the fictional town of Mystic Falls,
[Virginia](/wiki/Virginia "Virginia"), a town charged with supernatural
history since its settlement of migrants from New England in the late 19th
century. It follows the life of [Elena Gilbert](/wiki/Elena_Gilbert "Elena
Gilbert") ([Nina Dobrev](/wiki/Nina_Dobrev "Nina Dobrev")), a teenage girl who
has just lost both parents in a car accident, as she falls in love with a
162-year-old vampire named [Stefan Salvatore](/wiki/Stefan_Salvatore "Stefan
Salvatore") ([Paul Wesley](/wiki/Paul_Wesley "Paul Wesley")). Their
relationship becomes increasingly complicated as Stefan's mysterious older
brother [Damon Salvatore](/wiki/Damon_Salvatore "Damon Salvatore") ([Ian
Somerhalder](/wiki/Ian_Somerhalder "Ian Somerhalder")) returns, with a plan to
bring back their past lover Katherine Pierce, a vampire who looks exactly like
Elena. Although Damon is initially the villain and harbors a grudge against
his brother for forcing him to become a vampire, he later reconciles with
Stefan and falls in love with Elena, creating a love triangle among the three.
Both brothers protect Elena as they face various villains and threats to their
town, including Katherine. The brothers' history and the town's mythology are
revealed through flashbacks as the series goes on.

Additional storylines revolve around the other inhabitants of the town, most
notably Elena's younger brother [Jeremy Gilbert](/wiki/Jeremy_Gilbert "Jeremy
Gilbert") ([Steven R. McQueen](/wiki/Steven_R._McQueen "Steven R. McQueen")),
her best friends [Bonnie Bennett](/wiki/Bonnie_Bennett "Bonnie Bennett") ([Kat
Graham](/wiki/Kat_Graham "Kat Graham")) and [Caroline
Forbes](/wiki/Caroline_Forbes "Caroline Forbes") ([Candice
King](/wiki/Candice_King "Candice King")), their mutual friends [Tyler
Lockwood](/wiki/Tyler_Lockwood "Tyler Lockwood") ([Michael
Trevino](/wiki/Michael_Trevino "Michael Trevino")) and [Matt
Donovan](/wiki/Matt_Donovan_\(fictional_character\) "Matt Donovan \(fictional
character\)") ([Zach Roerig](/wiki/Zach_Roerig "Zach Roerig")), and their
history teacher, vampire hunter [Alaric Saltzman](/wiki/Alaric_Saltzman
"Alaric Saltzman") ([Matthew Davis](/wiki/Matthew_Davis "Matthew Davis")). The
town's politics are orchestrated by descendants of the original founding
families, all comprising a "Founders' Council." The founding families of
Mystic Falls includes the Salvatores, the Gilberts, the Fells, the Forbes, and
the Lockwoods. They guard the town mainly from [vampires](/wiki/Vampire
"Vampire"), although there are many more supernatural threats such as
werewolves, witches, hybrids, ghosts and many more.

## Cast and
characters[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Vampire_Diaries&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: Cast and characters")]

Main article: [List of The Vampire Diaries
characters](/wiki/List_of_The_Vampire_Diaries_characters "List of The Vampire
Diaries characters")

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2c/The_Vampire_Diaries_at_PaleyFest_2014.jpg/220px-
The_Vampire_Diaries_at_PaleyFest_2014.jpg)](/wiki/File:The_Vampire_Diaries_at_PaleyFest_2014.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:The_Vampire_Diaries_at_PaleyFest_2014.jpg "Enlarge")

[Ian Somerhalder](/wiki/Ian_Somerhalder "Ian Somerhalder"), [Nina
Dobrev](/wiki/Nina_Dobrev "Nina Dobrev") and [Paul Wesley](/wiki/Paul_Wesley
"Paul Wesley") at [PaleyFest](/wiki/PaleyFest "PaleyFest") 2014

  * [Nina Dobrev](/wiki/Nina_Dobrev "Nina Dobrev") as [Elena Gilbert](/wiki/Elena_Gilbert "Elena Gilbert") (seasons 1–6; uncredited voiceover season 7; guest season 8),[9] whom the series follows as she falls in love with Stefan, and later leaves him after leading everyone to believe he was her true love, for his brother, Damon Salvatore, creating a love triangle. This results in her being drawn into the supernatural world, with the show following her struggles in surviving supernatural events in the town. Dobrev also portrays Elena's doppelgänger, Katerina Petrova also known as [Katherine Pierce](/wiki/Katherine_Pierce "Katherine Pierce"). Katherine sporadically appeared in subsequent seasons and played a significant role in the fifth season. Dobrev has also played the Original doppelgänger, Silas's true love known as Amara during the fifth season, whom he sought in the afterlife for two thousand years. Dobrev also played another Doppelgänger Tatia in _[The Originals](/wiki/The_Originals_\(TV_series\) "The Originals \(TV series\)")_ season 2 episode "Red Door."[10] In the season 6 finale, Elena's life was tied to Bonnie's in such a way that as long as Bonnie is alive Elena will remain asleep. Damon put Elena in a coffin and had Tyler hide her in a warehouse in Brooklyn for the next 60 years or so while he waits to reunite with her. In the series finale Elena is awoken and she ends up choosing Damon in the series finale and they live a long and happy life together, earning her happy ending.
  * [Paul Wesley](/wiki/Paul_Wesley "Paul Wesley") as [Stefan Salvatore](/wiki/Stefan_Salvatore "Stefan Salvatore"),[11] a good-hearted and affectionate vampire and the complete opposite of his older brother, Damon Salvatore. Later in the series, Stefan reverts to his old ways as a Ripper to save Damon from a werewolf bite and his role becomes more antagonistic, especially after he is forced to turn his humanity off. Eventually, he returns to his good-hearted and caring self and reconciles with Elena, but the relationship doesn't last long. He marries Caroline in Season 8 and is killed afterwards in the series finale as he sacrifices himself for Mystic Falls. Wesley also portrays his revealed doppelgänger, Silas (seasons 4–5), the world's first immortal being. Wesley also played another doppelgänger, Tom Avery, during the fifth season.
  * [Ian Somerhalder](/wiki/Ian_Somerhalder "Ian Somerhalder") as [Damon Salvatore](/wiki/Damon_Salvatore "Damon Salvatore"),[12] the malevolent vampire brother who initially served as the show's anti-hero. He is mostly thought of as selfish and manipulative, but later on in the series, he begins to display a more caring side. Though his love for Elena is initially one-sided, she begins to develop feelings for him as they work together to save Stefan after he's given in to his Ripper side. They begin dating in season 4, and continue to date (with some breakups along the way) until Elena is put into her deep sleep at the end of season 6. Damon is extremely close with Stefan, but also has a close relationship with Bonnie, despite the fact that they hated each other for the first 5 seasons of the series. Throughout seasons 6 and 7, their relationship has developed into a deeper bond, with Damon later confirming Bonnie is his best friend.
  * [Steven R. McQueen](/wiki/Steven_R._McQueen "Steven R. McQueen") as [Jeremy Gilbert](/wiki/Jeremy_Gilbert "Jeremy Gilbert") (seasons 1–6; guest season 8),[13] Elena's younger brother, later revealed to be her biological cousin and a member of The Five, a vampire hunter. Jeremy is killed in season 4 after Katherine throws him onto Silas, who drains his blood. He is resurrected by Bonnie Bennett, his love interest, in the season 4 finale. He leaves town numerous times during the show, and has only come back once since his exit mid season 6, to say goodbye to Elena.
  * [Sara Canning](/wiki/Sara_Canning "Sara Canning") as [Jenna Sommers](/wiki/Jenna_Sommers "Jenna Sommers") (seasons 1–2; guest seasons 3, 5, 8),[14] Jeremy and Elena's aunt and legal guardian. Canning left the show after season two when Jenna was killed after being turned into a vampire and used for Klaus' ritual.
  * [Kat Graham](/wiki/Kat_Graham "Kat Graham") as [Bonnie Bennett](/wiki/Bonnie_Bennett "Bonnie Bennett"),[15] Elena and Caroline's best friend and a very powerful witch, who has died numerous times during the show but always returned. She develops and controls her powers with the help of her grandmother, Sheila or "Grams", another witch in the family. She is often able to use her magic to help the group, and while she initially hates vampires, particularly Damon, she ends up warming up to them and becomes Damon's best friend after being stuck in a prison world with him for four months. Bonnie has lost and regained her ability to do magic multiple times throughout the show. She spent seasons 2 through 5 in an on-again, off-again relationship with Elena's brother Jeremy and later became involved with Enzo.
  * [Candice King](/wiki/Candice_King "Candice King") as [Caroline Forbes](/wiki/Caroline_Forbes "Caroline Forbes"),[16] Bonnie and Elena's best friend, who was insecure and often jealous of Elena at first, but after becoming a vampire in the second season comes into her own. Neurotic but lovable, Caroline has been the love interest of many of the male characters. Initially serving as Damon's plaything in season 1, which she still hates him for, she has had serious relationships with Matt, Tyler, Alaric, and Stefan, and was long the subject of Klaus's adoration. She married Stefan before his death. Currently, she is raising twins with Alaric.
  * [Zach Roerig](/wiki/Zach_Roerig "Zach Roerig") as [Matt Donovan](/wiki/Matt_Donovan_\(fictional_character\) "Matt Donovan \(fictional character\)"),[17] Elena's childhood friend and ex-boyfriend, who became romantically involved with Caroline in season 1. They remain good friends even after breaking up during the second season. Matt wants no part in the supernatural events in his town and later is at odds with the vampires as he becomes a police officer and tries to protect the town from them.
  * [Kayla Ewell](/wiki/Kayla_Ewell "Kayla Ewell") as [Vicki Donovan](/wiki/Vicki_Donovan "Vicki Donovan") (season 1; recurring seasons 2–3, 5, 8), the drug-addicted sister of Matt. She appears to be dating Tyler but is more interested in Jeremy. She is turned into a vampire by Damon and is killed by Stefan shortly after. Ewell left the show after the first season but has appeared as a guest in multiple seasons since.
  * [Michael Trevino](/wiki/Michael_Trevino "Michael Trevino") as [Tyler Lockwood](/wiki/Tyler_Lockwood "Tyler Lockwood") (seasons 1–6; recurring seasons 7–8),[18] a werewolf later turned into a hybrid, Jeremy and Matt's best friend, and son of the mayor of Mystic Falls; male members of his family have been shown to carry a lycanthropic trait. His uncle Mason was also a werewolf, who was killed by Damon in season two. He was turned into the first successful hybrid by Klaus. In the season 5 finale, he is returned to being just a werewolf. He leaves town at the end of season 6, though he appears in a couple episodes of season 7, protecting Elena's coffin.
  * [Matt Davis](/wiki/Matthew_Davis "Matthew Davis") as [Alaric Saltzman](/wiki/Alaric_Saltzman "Alaric Saltzman") (seasons 1–3, 6–8; recurring season 4–5),[19] a history teacher, vampire hunter, and love interest for Jenna. Davis left the show at the end of season three after Alaric was killed. His character returned as a regular in season 6, after he was resurrected.[20] Alaric is able to return to being a human with the help of [Josette Laughlin](/w/index.php?title=Josette_Laughlin&action=edit&redlink=1 "Josette Laughlin \(page does not exist\)") ([Jodi Lyn O'Keefe](/wiki/Jodi_Lyn_O%27Keefe "Jodi Lyn O'Keefe")) and the two begin dating. Jo becomes pregnant and they plan to marry, but she is murdered by Kai at their wedding. Jo's family of witches was able to transfer the babies to Caroline, however, so she gives birth to their twins, and Caroline and Alaric move to Dallas together. They begin a relationship, but end it when Caroline decides to be with Stefan after his return at the end of season 7.
  * [Joseph Morgan](/wiki/Joseph_Morgan_\(actor\) "Joseph Morgan \(actor\)")[21] as [Original Vampire](/wiki/Original_Vampires_\(The_Vampire_Diaries\) "Original Vampires \(The Vampire Diaries\)") [Klaus Mikaelson](/wiki/Klaus_Mikaelson "Klaus Mikaelson") (seasons 3–4, recurring season 2; guest seasons 5, 7). He begins to build an army of new "hybrids," which are half vampire and half werewolf. During season 3, Klaus began to develop feelings for Caroline and falls in love with her. Morgan left the show after the fourth season when Klaus moved on to his own spin-off, _[The Originals](/wiki/The_Originals_\(TV_series\) "The Originals \(TV series\)")_.
  * [Michael Malarkey](/wiki/Michael_Malarkey "Michael Malarkey")[22] as [Enzo St. John](/wiki/Enzo_St._John "Enzo St. John") (seasons 6–8; recurring season 5), a vampire formerly under the imprisonment of the Augustine society. He was Damon Salvatore's cellmate back in the 1950s when the latter was captured by the Augustines. He and Damon revived their friendship as he searched for his lost lover, Maggie. In the episode "Man on Fire," Enzo shut off his humanity and then Stefan Salvatore ripped out his heart. He was resurrected in the season finale, and later becomes Bonnie's love interest before coming under the control of the monster in the vault at the end of season 7.

##
Production[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Vampire_Diaries&action=edit&section=4
"Edit section: Production")]

Initially, [Kevin Williamson](/wiki/Kevin_Williamson_\(screenwriter\) "Kevin
Williamson \(screenwriter\)") had little interest in developing the series,
finding the premise too similar to other vampire tales. However, at the urging
of [Julie Plec](/wiki/Julie_Plec "Julie Plec"), he began to read the novels
and started to become intrigued by the story: "I began to realize that it was
a story about a small town, about that town's underbelly and about what lurks
under the surface."[23] Williamson has stated the town's story will be the
main focus of the series rather than high school.[24]

On February 6, 2009, _Variety_ announced that The CW had green-lit the pilot
for _The Vampire Diaries_ with Williamson and Julie Plec set as the head
writers and executive producers.[25] On May 19, 2009, the series was
officially ordered for the 2009–2010 season.[26]

The pilot episode was filmed in [Vancouver](/wiki/Vancouver "Vancouver"),
[British Columbia](/wiki/British_Columbia "British Columbia"), but the rest of
the episodes have been filmed in [Covington, Georgia](/wiki/Covington,_Georgia
"Covington, Georgia") (which doubles as the show's fictional small town of
Mystic Falls, [Virginia](/wiki/Virginia "Virginia")) and various other
communities around [Greater Atlanta](/wiki/Atlanta_metropolitan_area "Atlanta
metropolitan area")[27] to take advantage of local tax incentives. On the
morning of May 10, 2012, a fire broke out in the building on Clark Street in
Covington that was used as the setting for Mystic Grill on the show.[28]

The series was given a full 22-episode order on October 21, 2009, after strong
ratings for the first half of the season. Now there is a spin-off called _[The
Originals](/wiki/The_Originals_\(TV_series\) "The Originals \(TV series\)")_ ,
that goes into depth about the original vampire family from _The Vampire
Diaries_.[29] On February 16, 2010, The CW announced that it had renewed the
show for a second season,[30] which premiered on September 9, 2010.[31] On
April 26, 2011, The CW renewed the show for a third season.[32] The third
season premiered on September 15, 2011.[33] The fourth season premiered
October 11, 2012. The CW renewed the show for a fifth season on February 11,
2013.[34] On February 13, 2014, The CW renewed the series for a sixth
season.[35] On January 11, 2015, the CW renewed the series for a seventh
season.

President of The CW, Mark Pedowitz, said in an interview at the summer TCA's
that _The Vampire Diaries_ didn't receive an extra episode order for the
[second season](/wiki/The_Vampire_Diaries_\(season_2\) "The Vampire Diaries
\(season 2\)") at the request of Kevin Williamson. Kevin Williamson felt to do
the best show possible, he would rather do 22 episodes. "I'd rather have a
great 22 than a good 24 if Kevin couldn't do it," he explained.[36] The first
writers meeting for the [fifth season](/wiki/The_Vampire_Diaries_\(season_5\)
"The Vampire Diaries \(season 5\)") held on April 15, 2013. Filming began on
July 10, 2013, and finished on April 10, 2014. On July 23, 2016, it was
announced that show would end after a 16-episode eighth season.[37]

_The Vampire Diaries_ initially received mixed reviews, which through the
course of the show improved greatly. [Metacritic](/wiki/Metacritic
"Metacritic") gave the show a Metascore of 50 (out of 100) based on 22
critical reviews, indicating "mixed or average reviews".[38] _[Entertainment
Weekly](/wiki/Entertainment_Weekly "Entertainment Weekly")_ gave the pilot a
B+, declaring that the show "signals a welcome return to form for writer-
producer Kevin Williamson." Reviewer, Ken Tucker, ended his review by writing
that "_Diaries_ promises us a season of sharp-tongued amusement."[39] Linda
Stasi of the _[New York Post](/wiki/New_York_Post "New York Post")_ gave the
premiere a perfect score, saying that she was "hooked after one episode."
Stasi praised the pacing of the episode and the "vicious, bloody vamp action,"
which "starts in the opening scene and continues throughout _The Vampire
Diaries_ with such ferocity and speed that it's truly scary."[40] Conversely,
_[San Francisco Chronicle](/wiki/San_Francisco_Chronicle "San Francisco
Chronicle")_ 's, Tim Goodman, gave the episode a highly critical review,
calling the series "awful." Goodman disliked the dialogue and hoped that the
[extras](/wiki/Extra_\(actor\) "Extra \(actor\)") on _[Buffy the Vampire
Slayer](/wiki/Buffy_the_Vampire_Slayer_\(TV_series\) "Buffy the Vampire Slayer
\(TV series\)")_ would "return en masse to eat the cast of _Vampire Diaries_ ,
plus any remaining scripts."[41]

Many TV critics felt the series improved with each episode. Sarah Hughes of
_[The Independent](/wiki/The_Independent "The Independent")_ says _The Vampire
Diaries_ turns into "a well-crafted, interestingly developed series" despite a
poor opening episode.[23] The _[New York Post](/wiki/New_York_Post "New York
Post")_ also praised the portrayal of Elena, finding the character to be a
strong-minded woman who did not allow her feelings for her boyfriend to
control her.[42] Karla Peterson of _[The San Diego Union-
Tribune](/wiki/The_San_Diego_Union-Tribune "The San Diego Union-Tribune")_
said that "the supernatural drama is a first-class production, featuring an
insanely gorgeous cast, sharp scripts, and a brooding vibe that is hard for
even the most levelheaded adult to resist."[43] Mike Hale of _[The New York
Times](/wiki/The_New_York_Times "The New York Times")_ gave the series an
honorable mention on his list of the top TV shows of 2009.[44]

The show's second season opened to favorable reviews from professional
television critics as it received a 78/100 score on
[Metacritic](/wiki/Metacritic "Metacritic"). As the series progressed and
developed onto the third season, critics praised the portrayals of the main
characters and the development of the female characters such as [Elena
Gilbert](/wiki/Elena_Gilbert "Elena Gilbert") played by [Nina
Dobrev](/wiki/Nina_Dobrev "Nina Dobrev"), [Bonnie
Bennett](/wiki/Bonnie_Bennett "Bonnie Bennett") played by [Kat
Graham](/wiki/Kat_Graham "Kat Graham"), and [Caroline
Forbes](/wiki/Caroline_Forbes "Caroline Forbes") played by [Candice
King](/wiki/Candice_King "Candice King").

The third-season finale, "[The
Departed](/wiki/The_Departed_\(The_Vampire_Diaries\) "The Departed \(The
Vampire Diaries\)")," received critical acclaim. Diana Steenbergen of IGN
praised the episode and the writers for clearing up a couple story lines and
making all of them come to a head. She also praised Dobrev's performance in
this episode, addressing her behaviour as another reason the final revelation
from Meredith was more shocking and believable. Similarly, Mandi Bierly of
Entertainment Weekly review praised the writer's skills in creating the more
unexpected final twist.[45]

### U.S. Nielsen
ratings[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Vampire_Diaries&action=edit&section=7
"Edit section: U.S. Nielsen ratings")]

The series premiere of _The Vampire Diaries_ on September 10, 2009, gave The
CW its biggest series premiere, scoring 4.91 million viewers.[46] Adding in
DVR numbers, the ratings for the premiere swelled to an official 5.7 million
viewers.[47] In 2016, a _[New York Times](/wiki/New_York_Times "New York
Times")_ study of the 50 TV shows with the most [Facebook
Likes](/wiki/Facebook_Like "Facebook Like") found that "as with several other
shows that focus on the supernatural", _The Vampire Diaries_ was "slightly
more popular outside of cities. That said, the show's fandom has the smallest
amount of spatial variation of all 50 shows".[48]

estimated viewers per episode of _The Vampire Diaries._ "Rank" refers to how
_The Vampire Diaries_ rated compared to the other television series which
aired during prime time hours.

[Ian Somerhalder](/wiki/Ian_Somerhalder "Ian Somerhalder") gained much
attention from critics and audiences, and won several acting awards.

_The Vampire Diaries_ won 7 [Teen Choice Awards](/wiki/Teen_Choice_Awards
"Teen Choice Awards") in 2010 including: Choice TV Show: Fantasy/Sci-Fi,
Choice TV Actor: Fantasy/Sci-Fi (Paul Wesley), Choice TV Actress: Fantasy/Sci-
Fi (Nina Dobrev), Choice TV: Villain (Ian Somerhalder), Choice TV: Breakout
Show, Choice TV: Female Breakout Star (Nina Dobrev) and Choice TV: Male
Breakout Star (Paul Wesley).[70][71] Other nominations were Choice Male Hottie
(Ian Somerhalder) and Choice TV: Female Scene Stealer (Kat Graham).[72] The
show won an award for Favorite New TV Drama at the 2010 [People's Choice
Awards](/wiki/People%27s_Choice_Awards "People's Choice Awards") and received
a nomination for Favorite Sci-Fi/Fantasy Show.[73] It was also nominated for a
[Saturn Award](/wiki/Saturn_Award "Saturn Award") for Best Network TV
Series.[74] On November 9, 2010, it received nominations for Favourite Sci-
Fi/Fantasy Show and Favourite TV Drama as well as a nomination for [Ian
Somerhalder](/wiki/Ian_Somerhalder "Ian Somerhalder") in the TV Drama Actor
category at the 2011 [People's Choice Awards](/wiki/People%27s_Choice_Awards
"People's Choice Awards").[75]

## Home media
releases[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Vampire_Diaries&action=edit&section=9
"Edit section: Home media releases")]

Season one was released on DVD in [Regions 1, 2 and 4](/wiki/DVD_region_code
"DVD region code") and on [Blu-ray](/wiki/Blu-ray_Disc "Blu-ray Disc") in
Regions A and B. Both United States versions include commentary by cast and
crew members on selected episodes, deleted scenes, behind-the-scenes
featurettes, webisodes, and a downloadable [audiobook](/wiki/Audiobook
"Audiobook") of L.J. Smith's _The Vampire Diaries: The Awakening_.[84] It was
released on DVD in Region 2 on August 23, 2010.[85] Following that release,
Region 1 began selling DVDs on August 31, 2010,[84] and Region 3 on September
1, 2010.[86] In Region A, it was released on Blu-ray on August 31,
2010.[87][88] Region B's releases varied; United Kingdom on August 23,
2010,[89] Brazil on August 26, 2010,[90] and Australia on September 1,
2010.[91] _The Vampire Diaries Season 2_ will be available in DVD and Blu-ray
on August 30, 2011.[92] Region B's releases varied; United Kingdom on August
22, 2011,[93] Brazil on August 25, 2011. _The Vampire Diaries: Season 3_ will
be available on DVD and Blu-ray on September 11 and A and on September 5,
2012, for Regions 4 and B.[94][95][96] The Vampire Diaries: Season 4 is
available on DVD and Blu-ray in A as of September 15, 2013.

In Japan, the fourth season was released in a special collection including
bonuses not available elsewhere. Included in the collection are an ankle
bracelet, promotional image cards and a booklet about the cast.[97]

## Spin-
off[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Vampire_Diaries&action=edit&section=10 "Edit
section: Spin-off")]

Main article: [The Originals (TV series)](/wiki/The_Originals_\(TV_series\)
"The Originals \(TV series\)")

Former president of entertainment at The CW, [Dawn Ostroff](/wiki/Dawn_Ostroff
"Dawn Ostroff"), mentioned a [spin-off](/wiki/Spin-off_\(media\) "Spin-off
\(media\)") idea in 2010 that she said could happen in a few years.[137] A
spin-off was in development for the 2011 fall line-up but due to Kevin
Williamson's commitment to _[The Secret
Circle](/wiki/The_Secret_Circle_\(TV_series\) "The Secret Circle \(TV
series\)")_ , it was put on hold indefinitely.[138]

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f0/TheOriginalsLogo.png/220px-
TheOriginalsLogo.png)](/wiki/File:TheOriginalsLogo.png)

[](/wiki/File:TheOriginalsLogo.png "Enlarge")

Logo of The Originals

On January 11, 2013, it was announced that a [back-door
pilot](/wiki/Backdoor_pilots "Backdoor pilots") focused on the Originals,
starring [Joseph Morgan](/wiki/Joseph_Morgan_\(actor\) "Joseph Morgan
\(actor\)") as Klaus titled _[The Originals](/wiki/The_Originals_\(TV_series\)
"The Originals \(TV series\)")_ would air on April 25 for a potential series
pick-up for the 2013–2014 season.[139] This second spin-off attempt was
carried out by [Julie Plec](/wiki/Julie_Plec "Julie Plec") with no involvement
by Kevin Williamson.[140]

On April 26, 2013, The CW announced that _The Originals_ had been ordered to
series premiere in the 2013–14 television season.[3] _The Originals_ premiered
on October 3, 2013.

[Daniel Gillies](/wiki/Daniel_Gillies "Daniel Gillies") as Elijah, [Claire
Holt](/wiki/Claire_Holt "Claire Holt") as Rebekah, and [Phoebe
Tonkin](/wiki/Phoebe_Tonkin "Phoebe Tonkin") as Hayley will also continue to
play their characters, originally from _The Vampire Diaries_ , in the new
spin-off series.[141]

_The Originals_ is about the Mikaelson siblings, who are the original family
of vampires, and their take-over of New Orleans. The show also involves Hayley
and Klaus's daughter, Hope.

Producers reported that there would be a transition of the characters in both
series. [Claire Holt](/wiki/Claire_Holt "Claire Holt") made a special cameo on
episodes of _The Vampire Diaries_ , in the episodes "[I Know What You Did Last
Summer](/wiki/I_Know_What_You_Did_Last_Summer_\(The_Vampire_Diaries\) "I Know
What You Did Last Summer \(The Vampire Diaries\)")"[142] and "[500 Years of
Solitude](/wiki/500_Years_of_Solitude "500 Years of Solitude")".[143] [Michael
Trevino](/wiki/Michael_Trevino "Michael Trevino") made a special cameo on
episodes of _The Originals_ , "Bloodletting" and "The River In Reverse".
[Joseph Morgan](/wiki/Joseph_Morgan_\(actor\) "Joseph Morgan \(actor\)"),
[Daniel Gillies](/wiki/Daniel_Gillies "Daniel Gillies") and [Claire
Holt](/wiki/Claire_Holt "Claire Holt") returned to _The Vampire Diaries_ in a
special cameo on the series' 100th episode "[500 Years of
Solitude](/wiki/500_Years_of_Solitude "500 Years of Solitude")". Nina Dobrev
also appeared on the fifth episode of _The Originals_ 's second season, "Red
Door", as Tatia.

At the [Television Critics Association](/wiki/Television_Critics_Association
"Television Critics Association") winter 2016 press tour, CW president Mark
Pedowitz announced an official crossover between _The Vampire Diaries_ and
_The Originals_ where Stefan goes on the run and finds safe haven in New
Orleans where he runs into Klaus.[144]
